question: It can be inferred from the passage that the Countess of Huntingdon
options: helped Phillis get her writings published
was surprised that Phillis could read and write

question: What question is answered in last paragraph?
Phillis finally became free .............
options: when she published her-poems in England
after meeting the Countess of Huntingdon

question: Phillis‘ first attempt at selling her poetry in America (the colonies) was .................
Which of the following is TRUE about Phillis Wheatley?
options: She was the first African-American slave to visit England.
She was the first African-American and slave to publish a book in the United States.
She was the first African-American and slave to be able to read and write
She was the first African-American and slave to meet George Washington.

question: The Wheatley family estimated the age of the slave girl they named “Phills" by
By the age of twelve, Phillis was ...................
options: still not able to read or write

question: The slaveowner who sold Phillis to the Wheatley family believed ...............
options: she would soon recover from her illness
she was worth a lot of money
